{"step_by_step_thinking": "The dental lamina is a band of epithelial tissue seen in the development of a tooth. It is formed when cells of the oral ectoderm proliferate faster than cells of other areas. This information suggests that the dental lamina is initiated by cells of the oral ectoderm, which are derived from the neural crest cells during embryonic development.", "answer_choice": "C. Neural crest cells"}
